children.subject: Take this with a grain of salt of course but I don't think that 0.1 really matters to most companies; heard of lots of people getting good spots with less than a 3.0. For the companies that do really care about GPA, they'd be looking for really high 3s anyways (like study hardcore in all your classes grades). Although since it is on the borderline, it is worth mentioning that I have seen a few companies and programs that require people to have a 3.0+. If your friend has already had an internship, it doesn't seem like such a concern though; the experience alone should make it easier to get spots. Also, it may be worthwhile to have your friend talk to a GSI about their position because the class situation seems more pertinent here.

history.content:
Would companies treat a 2.9 student differently than a 3.0 student? I have a friend who is thinking of late dropping a class because they fear a bad grade, and they are dangling between 3.0 and 2.X, probably 2.9.

They are graduating this fall and will be full time recruiting for a PM position. They will have their first PM internship this summer(apparently a semi known company in Bay Area, not Big N). Their final is worth 30% so this person has time to recover.

Maybe they could chime in on this thread for more details but that’s all I know for now.
